conclusion: To find the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force acting on the trapezoidal frame.
The resistance R of a wire is given by R = (ρL)/S.
For each side of the trapezoid: ab = bc = cd = L.
The equivalent resistance of ab and cd in parallel is R_parallel = (ρL)/(2S).
Adding bc in series, the equivalent resistance R_eq = (3ρL)/(2S).
The current I through the circuit is I = (2ES)/(3ρL).
The Ampere force F on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = BIL.
For each side, F_ab = F_bc = F_cd = (2BES)/(3ρ).
Using the right-hand rule, F_ab and F_cd are perpendicular to AD and directed outward, F_bc is perpendicular to bc and directed inward.
The forces on ab and cd cancel each other out.
The resultant force is due to F_bc: F_resultant = (2BES)/(3ρ).
The direction of F_bc is horizontally to the left.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force is (2BES)/(3ρ) and the direction is horizontally to the left.
